snippet: Drug overdoses killed nearly 50,000 Americans last year: more than were killed in auto accidents, and twice as many as died from overdoses in 2000.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention releases data that shows almost 50,000 Americans died because of drug overdoses in 2014, double number who died of overdoses in 2000; majority of deaths involved heroin or prescription narcotic painkillers.
lead_paragraph: Drug overdoses killed nearly 50,000 Americans last year: more than were killed in auto accidents, and twice as many as died from overdoses in 2000.

headline.main: Overdose Deaths Reached a New High in 2014
